jobs.title: Pre Sales Manager
jobs.description:
Pre Sales Manager

Dubai - UAE

DESCRIPTION

Company Profile: Engineer.ai provides peace-of-mind-outsourcing through the brands;

Engineer.ai for development (Builder), and CloudOps for cloud billing and managed services.

The centerfold of our strategy is to use artificial intelligence, ridiculous brain power & deeply vested partnership for bringing ideas to life. With over 400 Clients worldwide; over 1 billion views of properties we’ve built and more than 50m engaged users, we are starting the next outsourcing revolution; one ecstatic customer as a time.

Website: www.engineer.ai (https://workable.com/nr?l=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.engineer.ai%2F)

Position Overview: As a Pre-Sales person, you need to support sales productivity and deal flow resulting in technical closure of new business, collaborate with sales, engineering and support resources to prepare the proposed deals.

You will be also be responsible for following activities:

* Taking part in the proposal process in the functional scoping of response to RFPs, & RFIs, Tenders; design and draft architecture diagrams, suggest time estimates, suggest methodology, provide estimation of project time and cost and write white papers.
* Single point of contact for technical support to the Sales team.
* Involved in preparing scope-of-work, and proof-of-concept study.
* Responsible for interacting with delivery and sales team; doing the system study and preparing the specification document, understanding their business & technology needs and advise sales team accordingly.
* Should have Market Intelligence like Competitor Product Analysis, Pricing, Wins, Concern areas
* Responsible for identification of new product and application areas and also suggesting upgrades, carrying out market research for newer market segment.
* Planning of sales strategies and demonstration of the business.

Job Specs - In the first 6 months you will be responsible for:

* Adding necessary certifications to your portfolio based on business needs
* Knowledge sharing with Sales team
* Understand the nature of business, become familiar with the existing customer base, and provide technical inputs for driving sales

* Work in tandem with the sales teams to manage campaigns, demand generation drives
* Work with Marketing team in building campaigns and helping build relevant technical content for the business
* Help the sales team in identifying cross sell, upsell opportunities with existing clients
* Drafting Proposals, responding to RFPs, RFIs and RFQs, creating time and cost estimates, customer engagement
* Mapping opportunities for POCs, Upselling and Cross-selling of CloudOps.ai platform and AWS

Culture

Our culture is a hybrid of mature business and quirky startup; as we’ve grown to deliver an aggregate revenue of US$ 60m and remaining profitable in less than 4 years. We are a brand that aspires to do away with the taboo of being a “boring” software company.

We want team players, who roll up their sleeves, are open to being challenged and also understand the importance of respect, integrity and can balance that with irreverence, cheekiness. Most importantly, any role in www.engineer.ai (https://workable.com/nr?l=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.engineer.ai%2F) is like joining our family.

Requirements

* Four year college degree from an accredited institution.
* Familiarity with software and applications such as CRM and productivity Tools.
* Good interpersonal, presentation and communication skills.
* Strong customer service orientation.
* Analytical skills and the ability to recognize the demands on the side of the clients.

Benefits

  • Mapping opportunities for POCs, Upselling and Cross-selling of CloudOps.ai platform and AWS

Culture

Our culture is a hybrid of mature business and quirky startup; as we’ve grown to deliver an aggregate revenue of US$ 60m and remaining profitable in less than 4 years. We are a brand that aspires to do away with the taboo of being a “boring” software company.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
As a Product Manager, you should be able to plan, implement, and track specific short-term deliverables. You should be comfortable in laying out highly detailed product requirements, strategizing product roadmap, and implementing competitive insights and growth hacks

- Product Ownership: You should make product goals your own and use your skills and expertise to inspire a sense of shared purpose within the team.

- Responsibility and Accountability for the Product: Responsible for using best practice PMO methodology to create a product plan to fit the stakeholders/customers’ needs and deliver within budget on desired outcomes within the stipulated timeline.

- Define Product Roles and Responsibilities: Working closely with the Customer Experience Lead, Sales Team, Engineering, Design and QA to define the product goals and objectives.

- Makes Things Happen: Have the knowledge, skills and experience to be able to recognise when problems surface or potential problems are looming. He/she should be capable of taking on different challenges and making things possible even though they seem impossible at first.

- Promotes Customer Involvement: The PM recognizes that product success is directly related to satisfying the customer; therefore, customer involvement is essential to ensure that the right product is built.

- Promotes Good Working Relationships: The PM serves as a role model in promoting good working relationships across a product. PMs cultivate the people skills needed to develop trust and communication among all of a product's stakeholders: its sponsors, those who will make use of the results, those who command the resources needed, and the team members.

jobs.title: Product Manager - Shoto
jobs.description:
We are looking forward to a hands-on Product Manager who can work very closely with cross-functional product team on all initiatives. The individual must have excellent interpersonal skills and a natural flair for associating and connecting with people at all levels. Bonus for experience as project manager of e-commerce products and strategies.

Why We Need This Role

We need a spearhead who can

* Strategize product roadmap for Builder Studio and create detailed requirements.
* Be able to own entire agile project lifecycle while indirectly managing cross-functional development team and setting/meeting aggressive squad goals.
* Should be able to continuously test and optimize products aiming customer satisfaction.
* Recognize that product success is directly related to the customer satisfaction; therefore, customer involvement is essential to ensure that the right product is built.
* Lead integration efforts with third-party products and services.
* See through user segments, user life cycle and drive the ideation, development, and product strategies.
* Manage diverse internal and external stakeholders to ensure successful product launches.
* Should be able to suggest stakeholders for short and long term solutions with The vision of Builder Studio in mind.
* Go into wild, spot trends, observe market and user needs and draw inferences and suggest innovative solutions to add user value in platform.

Why You Should Join

This is a challenging and diverse role that requires you to function as an Individual contributor first and in future build an organization from the ground up. Only join if you understand and are passionate about the software development process. Knowledge of work coordination involved between customer and teams executing the project will be an added advantage and preferred.

Requirements

* Entrepreneurship, self-starting to deliver scope efficiently with velocity and focus.
* At least 2 + years of product management within B2C (required) companies.
* Adept knowledge of customer project coordination lifecycle and varied 3rd party tools involved.
* Self-motivated, quick and assertive.
* Extremely detailed oriented and organized.
* Excellent writing and communication skills.
* Ability to approach product ideation and testing using guerrilla strategies.
* Ability to develop product plans, manage individual deadlines and goals.
* Ability to define KPIs and measure product performance supported by qualitative feedback.
* An aggressive approach for A/B and multivariate testing.
* Ability to identify issues and problems, generate solutions and choose appropriate alternatives using basic root cause analysis.
* Strong data and technical proficiency, including experience with web analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Mixpanel).
* Able to "roll up your sleeves" to do what is needed in urgent situations while maintaining a "big-picture" view.
* Cool, calm, collected and collaborative work well under pressure and comfortable with change and complexity in dynamic environments.

Benefits

List out company perks and benefits, including some about your team!

* Performance-based bonuses

* Generous vacation and time off benefits
* Mission-driven company that is making the world a better place

jobs.title: Project Manager - Customer Product Expert
jobs.description:
We are looking for a versatile & out of box innovator who will be at the forefront of cutting AI technology that is disrupting a combined $800 billion (and growing) industry for software build and operate services, selling into both the B2C and B2B markets. The Project Manager will take a project from Design to Delivery. These experts play the role of the product to the customer.


Why We Need This Role

As a Project Manager you should be able to plan, implement, and track specific short-term deliverables. You should be comfortable in laying out highly detailed product requirements, strategizing product roadmap, and implementing competitive insights and growth hacks.


Why You Should Join

Our culture is a cross between serious business and quirky startup; as we’ve grown from $0.5m to $45m in less than 4 years. We want team players who roll up their sleeves, are open to being challenged and also understand the importance of respect, integrity and can that balance that with irreverence, cheekiness and a brand that aspires to do away with the taboo of being a “boring” software company. Most importantly, any role in Engineer.ai is like joining our family.

* First Six Month Deliverables
** On time delivery of the project (as per build card)
** Spec call to paid build card conversion
** Customer Rating
*** Client Satisfaction Score
*** Rating of shipped apps

** High customer response time – adherence to TATs
** Accuracy of project plans

Requirements

* Passionate about loosely held values and ideas. We want someone who has experience but is not blinded by the path already taken.
* A minimum Bachelor Degree, 3 - 6 years of project management experience.
* Technical Knowledge is a must - Prefer experience from a large tech company.
* Understand and use project management techniques / tools like agile and scrum
* Self-motivated, quick and assertive
* Be able to have effective conversations with the customer as a part of the design to delivery interactions – and even make recommendations to the customers for help in prioritizing.
* Ability to develop project/product plans, manage individual deadlines and goals.
* knowledge of basic structures and product roadmap - features, modules, MVP, A/B testing, UX driven product development, product analytics.
* Ability to identify issues and problems, generate solutions and choose appropriate alternatives using basic root cause analysis.
* Good cross organization and external stakeholder management.
* Manage client expectations, anticipates operational and tactical risks and tracks them.
* Should have a broad understanding of business, cost structures and prototypes

Benefits

* Health and Wellness benefits including competitive medical, dental, and vision plans
* Performance-based bonuses and stock options
* Generous vacation and time off benefits including paid holidays
* Generally flexible working hours
* Working in a beautiful office space the heart of Silicon Beach in Playa Vista
* A collaborative culture where unconventional thinkers come together to solve interesting problems and having fun while doing it
* Mission-driven company that is making the world a better place

jobs.title: QA Engineer
jobs.description:
As a QA Engineer you will estimate, plan, and coordinate testing activities. You will also ensure that quality issues and defects are appropriately identified, documented, tracked, and resolved in our defect tracking system.


Key Responsibilities:

* Review requirements specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
* Create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases
* Estimate, prioritize, plan, and coordinate testing activities
* Design test cases based on the use cases and considering various quality aspects.
* Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved
* Perform in-depth and thorough testing of the owned features/areas.
* Maintain the test cases and test results in test management system.
* Maintain the defects in defect Management system.
* Plan and realise the test environment, platforms, test cycles and regression cycles based on the strategy and quality evaluation at different stages of the product.
* Keep updated on the latest testing and domain technologies, test coverage methodologies and quality metrics.
* Develop skills on automation and testing tools.
* Should guide junior members in performing their activities effectively and help them develop technical skills.

Requirements

* BE/B-Tech/BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject
* Should have at least 2 years of relevant experience in QA, Automation and Penetration.
* Proven working experience in software quality assurance
* Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes
* Experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test plans and test cases
* Hands-on experience with both white box and black box testing
* Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process
* Experience with performance and/or security testing is a plus
* Hands-on experience with automated testing tools is a plus
* Knowledge of SQL and scripting is big plus

Benefits

Engineer.ai is an online platform for building software using AI & a marketplace of teams. Builder takes care of everything from idea to app and CloudOps ensures that your idea stays healthy and operates efficiently in the Cloud. Engineer.ai’s vision is to be the #1 way to Build Software and ultimately to be the connect between every idea and product; helping everyone who wants to engage in technology without needing to know how to build it.

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developer - CloudOps
jobs.description:
We are looking for a versatile backend developer who can innovate and develop scalable and robust financial systems. Mastery in Ruby on Rails is a must, as well as exposure to financial platforms. We also are looking for people who are strongly detail oriented and self driven. Furthermore, the willingness to experiment and learn on the job is crucial for success in this position.


Why we need this role:

We are looking to build a team that can help us develop our internal financial operating systems in a service oriented architecture that can integrate with all of our other products. This includes customizing and developing tools for accounting, revenue recognition, invoicing systems, etc and synchronizing them. We also want to be able automate repetitive financial tasks such as auditing and analysis.


Why you should join?

This is a specialized role that will allow you to refine your development skills, learn with a world class team, and challenge yourself. If you have an interest in financial technologies and want to be able to help drive innovation in a field that is not particularly known for innovation, then this is the role for you! You’ll need to comfortable with working with broadly defined scopes and with trying fast and failing fast.


First 6 Months OKRs

1. Build out a robust and scalable invoicing system that interacts with a service oriented architecture
a. Collaborate with multiple teams to create a unified invoicing and billing system for all internal products

2. Automate and optimize existing financial analysis and audit mechanisms
a. Create tooling to perform complex audits and reconciliations automatically
b. Create automatic validation tools for vendor invoices

3. Create internal dashboards to track major financial objectives in real-time
a. Create procedures that allow for real-time revenue recognition, cost monitoring and net revenue calculation
b. Create systems to manage unit economic analysis


Personality Traits

Passionate about loosely held values and ideas. We want someone who has experience but is not blinded by the path already taken.

Requirements

* Be able to write well documented code, that can be picked up and understood by any other developer
* At least 4 years of experience working with Ruby on Rails and common RoR frameworks
* Mixed experience in at least 2 complimentary languages, such as Javascript or Python
* Familiarity with common devOps practices needed for deploying and maintaining cloud based deployments, preferably AWS
* Experience working with common finance and accounting system integrations such as Xero, Quickbooks, NetSuite, etc. Familiarity with developing invoicing systems is a major plus.
* Working knowledge of standard CS fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, complexity analysis)
* Strong communication skills and a process driven approach
* Thorough understanding of standard Git workflows
* Ability to work in an agile and fast-paced work environment
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are looking for a versatile backend developer who can innovate and develop scalable and robust financial systems. Mastery in Ruby on Rails is a must, as well as exposure to financial platforms. We also are looking for people who are strongly detail oriented and self driven. Furthermore, the willingness to experiment and learn on the job is crucial for success in this position.

Why we need this role:

We are looking to build a team that can help us develop our internal financial operating systems in a service oriented architecture that can integrate with all of our other products. This includes customizing and developing tools for accounting, revenue recognition, invoicing systems, etc and synchronizing them. We also want to be able automate repetitive financial tasks such as auditing and analysis.

Why you should join?

This is a specialized role that will allow you to refine your development skills, learn with a world class team, and challenge yourself. If you have an interest in financial technologies and want to be able to help drive innovation in a field that is not particularly known for innovation, then this is the role for you! You’ll need to comfortable with working with broadly defined scopes and with trying fast and failing fast.

First 6 Months OKRs

  1. Build out a robust and scalable invoicing system that interacts with a service oriented architecture
    a. Collaborate with multiple teams to create a unified invoicing and billing system for all internal products

  2. Automate and optimize existing financial analysis and audit mechanisms
    a. Create tooling to perform complex audits and reconciliations automatically
    b. Create automatic validation tools for vendor invoices

  3. Create internal dashboards to track major financial objectives in real-time
    a. Create procedures that allow for real-time revenue recognition, cost monitoring and net revenue calculation
    b. Create systems to manage unit economic analysis

Personality Traits

Passionate about loosely held values and ideas. We want someone who has experience but is not blinded by the path already taken.

Requirements

  • Be able to write well documented code, that can be picked up and understood by any other developer
  • At least 4 years of experience working with Ruby on Rails and common RoR frameworks
  • Mixed experience in at least 2 complimentary languages, such as Javascript or Python
  • Familiarity with common devOps practices needed for deploying and maintaining cloud based deployments, preferably AWS
  • Experience working with common finance and accounting system integrations such as Xero, Quickbooks, NetSuite, etc. Familiarity with developing invoicing systems is a major plus.
  • Working knowledge of standard CS fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, complexity analysis)
  • Strong communication skills and a process driven approach
  • Thorough understanding of standard Git workflows
  • Ability to work in an agile and fast-paced work environment

jobs.title: Sales Executive
jobs.description:
We are looking for an experienced individual to contribute to our company’s sales objectives. As a Manager-BD, you should use creativity and thorough knowledge of Technical sales processes to provide innovative ideas for business growth. Ultimately, you should aspire to develop and maintain successful relationships with large, distributed customers.

* Responsible for devising/ updating the sales models in collaboration with management team
* Maintaining a thorough understanding of the market, clients industry, including industry trends, business processes, financial measurements and performance indicators, and key client competitors in their industry
* Pitching to CXOs of potential organizations, collaborating to increase the volume of business and exploring new methodologies to take the organization to the next level
* Defining marketing strategies and customer interaction model for the markets corporate sales function
* Build annual sales plan to then convert into quarterly and monthly operational plans and develop sales targets and volume goals at a regional level
* To monitor the monthly/quarterly sales achievement vs Targets (primary/secondary). Analyze the sales figures and take corrective action in case of non-achievement of targets
* Build and maintain relationships with key customers to farm and grow the revenues
* Go to market with new product launches and meet revenue target for the products.

Job Specs - In the first 6 months you will be responsible for:

* Develop a 90 – 120 day plan for sales and marketing for launching sales operations in Bangalore/Mumbai.
* Set targets for the market and strive to achieve targets
* Build technical expertise to understand the cloud and engineering offerings of Engineer.ai.
* Play a key role in launching new products and offers in the market
* Leverage relationships to dig out opportunities with companies in Bangalore/Mumbai and work with the team in India to participate and bid for business
* Report on a daily / weekly basis to the reporting manager on state of business and sales initiatives

Requirements

Skills and Qualifications

* Must have experience working for Microsoft Azure platforms.
* We are looking for a versatile & out of box innovator who can formulate strategies to increase the volume of business. The individual must be seasoned into Cloud Computing sales with strong expertise into interaction with CEOs / CTOs of potential organizations.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and a natural flair for associating and connecting with people across levels.
* Must have strong business acumen to spearhead the sales and business development function PAN India.


Company Brief :-

Engineer.ai is a Human-assisted AI that empowers everyone to independently build & operate tech products through two platforms that work together to be their virtual engineering team.; Engineer.ai for development, andCloudOps.ai for cloud billing and managed services. The centerfold of our strategy is to use artificial intelligence, ridiculous brain power & deeply vested partnership for bringing ideas to life. With over 400 Clients worldwide; over 1 billion views of properties we’ve built and more than 50m engaged users we are starting the next outsourcing revolution; one ecstatic customer at a time.


Culture

Our culture is a cross between serious business and quirky startup; as we’ve grown from $0.5m to $13m in less than 4 years.

We want team players, who roll up their sleeves, are open to being challenged and also understand the importance of respect, integrity and can that balance that with irreverence, cheekiness and a brand that aspires to do away with the taboo of being a “boring” software company.


Benefits

The main reason people choose a career at Engineer.ai is because of the work we do.

With innovation at the heart of our business, the variety of work is continuous as we collaborate with our clients to explore new ways of creating high performance. This will give you endless opportunities to challenge yourself with interesting work.

Another reason to join us is because our people enjoy working here. Engineer.ai is made up of diverse teams of highly motivated people who are committed to achieving outstanding results.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Developer
jobs.description:
DESCRIPTION

We are looking for a senior Ruby on Rails developer that brings their own ideas to the table.

This person must have significant expertise in ROR, as well as be highly detail oriented and self-driven.

Furthermore, they must be able to inspire and mentor others when the need arises. We are looking for someone never says “I do not know how”, or “I have never done that before” - rather a person that says how about we try this

* Architecting and designing scalable backend systems
* Integration and development of various microservices
* Creating unit tests using RSpec
* Reviewing other developers code as well as suggesting improvements
* Algorithm development and general optimization
* Setting up CI/CD pipelines
* Collaborating with various stakeholders including QA, DevOps, PMs and other developers
* 3+ years solid experience on Ruby on Rails, including at least one start to finish project where you were the lead developer or a primary contributor.
* Solid understanding of deploying and maintaining Rails apps within the AWS environment.
* Ability to set up workers and deploy across multiple instances.
* Git experience, some would say you are a git master.
* If I asked your previous co-workers about you, they would say you were a good team player
* Excellent communication skills.

6 Months Deliverable:

* Collaborate with designers, product managers, and other software developers to deliver compelling user-facing products
* Lead teams of developers in architecting efficient and reusable systems that drive complex applications across the stack
* Create instrumentation, monitoring, and alerting tools to ensure availability/scalability during peak traffic times and implement solutions to maximize uptime
* Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues



Requirements

Bonus Skills:

* Devops experience (chef/jenkins etc.)
* Understanding of the mobile landscape and how they interact with Restful API’s.
* Have built your own Gem.
* Python
* Integration of third party API’s, scraping, heavy data processing.

Benefits

Engineer.ai is an online platform for building software using AI & a marketplace of teams. Builder takes care of everything from idea to app and CloudOps ensures that your idea stays healthy and operates efficiently in the Cloud.

Engineer.ai’s vision is to be the #1 way to Build Software and ultimately to be the connect between every idea and product; helping everyone who wants to engage in technology without needing to know how to build it.

jobs.title: Senior Data Insights Analyst
jobs.description:
Why we need this role

We are looking for a Senior Data Insights Analyst to join our newly established and fast-paced Growth team at a stage where you can really make a difference. We plan to run hundreds of paid social and paid campaigns globally as well as to increase our in-product conversion and k factor and we need someone to analyse data and provide actionable insights for the entire business.

Why you should join

This is an exciting opportunity to join a Growth team in its early stage - therefore we are looking for someone who thrives in a fast paced environment and is proactive and thinks outside the box. The Growth team is data-driven and results focused. We are seeking a talented professional who thrives at the intersection of data, product and performance marketing. This is an amazing opportunity for someone to dive into data sets and drive business decisions based on insights and help the business grow. You will have the chance to work across all departments, supporting the constant improvement of our product and overall business growth, as well as automating data pipelines and integrations.


First Six Month Deliverables / OKRs
* Establish A/B testing strategy
* Insights into lead re-/targeting
* Correct & reliable reporting


What will you be doing?
* Define and evaluate key metrics and understand what moves them and why
* Owner of conceptualizing, developing, and maintaining dashboards and visualizations
* Communicate analyses and recommendations to cross functional stakeholders for decision making
* Partner with Engineering to improve data source quality
* Own A/B testing and optimisation activities related to Growth and marketing <> sales funnel
* Communicate Results – Identify successes, failures, trends, and effectively communicate these findings to the organization. If test results are positive – analyze KPI improvements in pre/post A/B test roll-outs; if results are negative – perform driver analysis to recommend next iteration of that test
* Explorative analysis i.e. how many pieces of content are consumed before a purchasing decision is made / which traffic sources convert at the highest rate and why / how does an event to purchase journey look like / how should we optimise geo targeting for trade shows
* Identify critical business problems and create analytical/modeling framework and solutions
* Translate complex findings and results into a compelling narrative

Requirements


* Advanced SQL and Tableau skills
* Experience in A/B and multivariate testing
* Have working experience with some of the following: Adstage, Google Ads, Facebook / Instagram Ads, LinkedIn Ads, Zoho/Hubspot, Salesforce
* Working experience with 3rd-party tracking vendors and integrating with social platforms.
* You will have the ability to interpret complex data sets and come up with actionable recommendations
* Good technical and analytical communication skills
* Commercially minded and always thinking of the customers' current and future needs
* You live and breathe data, and can use it to help teams make the right decisions
* Are excited by technology and will enjoy working in the fast pace of a start-up.
* Are passionate about loosely held values and ideas. We want someone who has experience but is not blinded by the path already taken.

Benefits

* Performance-based bonuses and stock options
* Generous vacation and time off benefits including paid holidays
* Generally flexible working hours
* A collaborative culture where unconventional thinkers come together to solve interesting problems and having fun while doing it
* Mission-driven company that is making the world a better place
* Healthcare package coming soon

jobs.title: Senior Engineer
jobs.description:
Who we are

At Engineer.ai we believe that anyone, irrespective of technical knowledge, should be able to build and operate technology. We make software accessible to everyone.

We are an AI-assisted platform building, maintaining and running bespoke software for our customers, making it faster, more accessible and less expensive for everyone to bring their ideas to life. 

We launched in 2012, and last year we secured $29.5m of funding to scale our growth in Europe. We already have three offices in LA, Delhi, and London and recently hit 250 employees globally. A key focus for us this year is to significantly grow our London operation. 

Why we need this role

BuilderCloud is a pillar of our business that focuses on provisioning, running and scaling the infrastructure that a customer’s idea is going to need to run on, at the best possible price for them. In order to rapidly expand our product offerings in this area, we would like to significantly expand our London engineering team. We are looking to hire engineers to work on areas such as intelligent cloud provider agnostic infrastructure usage analytics, secondary infrastructure marketplaces, interactive billing reports, devops automation tools and more.

What we need

We’re looking for senior engineers that enjoy a fast-paced startup environment, who are comfortable taking the lead on technical solutions, helping mentor and train junior developers as well as taking the initiative to contribute across the business where they can. 

If you’re a developer that ticks some or all of these boxes, we’d love to hear from you:

Strong experience in Ruby and Ruby on Rails.
Familiar with one or more cloud provider’s services. Experience with containerized applications and infrastructure provisioning would be a plus. 
Experience working in fast-paced and dynamic scrum teams.
Experience architecting and designing scalable solutions 
Passionate about loosely held values and ideas. We want someone who has experience but is not blinded by the path already taken.
 
 
What you’ll be doing in your first 6 months
 
Helping to shape the technical direction of new products/microservices
Writing performant, testable and stable Ruby/Rails code
Helping to unblock and coach mid level and junior team members
 
 
Our Tech Stack
 
Our in house platform teams work with a variety of technologies that’ll you’ll get to play with. Experience in some would be an advantage but is not strictly necessary. Most important is using the right tool for the job so we’re always evaluating what tech makes the most sense and we’d love for you to have some input in this.
 
Latest stable versions of Ruby/Rails (2.6 and 6.0 at time of writing)
Docker and Kubernetes
Git & GitLab
Python with Django
Postgres, MongoDB, Redis, Redshift
AWS, Azure, GCP, Digital Ocean
 

What you get in return
A supportive team and a fun relaxed work environment
Health and wellness benefits
Performance-based bonuses and stock options
Generally flexible working hours
Working in a modern office space in the heart of Paddington






    Want to know more?
https://youtu.be/xbkT0mE_V3Q

jobs.title: Senior Ruby Developer
jobs.description:
We are looking for a versatile backend developer who can innovate and develop scalable and robust financial systems. Mastery in Ruby on Rails is a must, as well as exposure to financial platforms. We also are looking for people who are strongly detail oriented and self driven. Furthermore, the willingness to experiment and learn on the job is crucial for success in this position.


Why we need this role:


We are looking to build a team that can help us develop our internal financial operating systems in a service oriented architecture that can integrate with all of our other products. This includes customizing and developing tools for accounting, revenue recognition, invoicing systems, etc and synchronizing them. We also want to be able automate repetitive financial tasks such as auditing and analysis.


Why you should join?


This is a specialized role that will allow you to refine your development skills, learn with a world class team, and challenge yourself. If you have an interest in financial technologies and want to be able to help drive innovation in a field that is not particularly known for innovation, then this is the role for you! You’ll need to comfortable with working with broadly defined scopes and with trying fast and failing fast.

Requirements

First 6 Months OKRs


1. Build out a robust and scalable invoicing system that interacts with a service oriented architecture
a. Collaborate with multiple teams to create a unified invoicing and billing system for all internal products

2. Automate and optimize existing financial analysis and audit mechanisms
a. Create tooling to perform complex audits and reconciliations automatically
b. Create automatic validation tools for vendor invoices

3. Create internal dashboards to track major financial objectives in real-time
a. Create procedures that allow for real-time revenue recognition, cost monitoring and net revenue calculation
b. Create systems to manage unit economic analysis



Personality Traits


Passionate about loosely held values and ideas. We want someone who has experience but is not blinded by the path already taken.


Requirements:

* Be able to write well documented code, that can be picked up and understood by any other developer
* At least 4 years of experience working with Ruby on Rails and common RoR frameworks
* Mixed experience in at least 2 complimentary languages, such as Javascript or Python
* Familiarity with common devOps practices needed for deploying and maintaining cloud based deployments, preferably AWS
* Experience working with common finance and accounting system integrations such as Xero, Quickbooks, NetSuite, etc. Familiarity with developing invoicing systems is a major plus.
* Working knowledge of standard CS fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, complexity analysis)
* Strong communication skills and a process driven approach
* Thorough understanding of standard Git workflows
* Ability to work in an agile and fast-paced work environment

Benefits

* Health and Wellness benefits including competitive medical, dental, and vision plans
* Performance-based bonuses and stock options
* Generous vacation and time off benefits including paid holidays
* Generally flexible working hours
* Working in the WeWork in Paddington, London
* A collaborative culture where unconventional thinkers come together to solve interesting problems and having fun while doing it
* Mission-driven company that is making the world a better place
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are looking for a versatile backend developer who can innovate and develop scalable and robust financial systems. Mastery in Ruby on Rails is a must, as well as exposure to financial platforms. We also are looking for people who are strongly detail oriented and self driven. Furthermore, the willingness to experiment and learn on the job is crucial for success in this position.

Why we need this role:

We are looking to build a team that can help us develop our internal financial operating systems in a service oriented architecture that can integrate with all of our other products. This includes customizing and developing tools for accounting, revenue recognition, invoicing systems, etc and synchronizing them. We also want to be able automate repetitive financial tasks such as auditing and analysis.

Why you should join?

This is a specialized role that will allow you to refine your development skills, learn with a world class team, and challenge yourself. If you have an interest in financial technologies and want to be able to help drive innovation in a field that is not particularly known for innovation, then this is the role for you! You’ll need to comfortable with working with broadly defined scopes and with trying fast and failing fast.

Requirements

First 6 Months OKRs

  1. Build out a robust and scalable invoicing system that interacts with a service oriented architecture
    a. Collaborate with multiple teams to create a unified invoicing and billing system for all internal products

  2. Automate and optimize existing financial analysis and audit mechanisms
    a. Create tooling to perform complex audits and reconciliations automatically
    b. Create automatic validation tools for vendor invoices

  3. Create internal dashboards to track major financial objectives in real-time
    a. Create procedures that allow for real-time revenue recognition, cost monitoring and net revenue calculation
    b. Create systems to manage unit economic analysis

Personality Traits

Passionate about loosely held values and ideas. We want someone who has experience but is not blinded by the path already taken.

Requirements:

  • Be able to write well documented code, that can be picked up and understood by any other developer
  • At least 4 years of experience working with Ruby on Rails and common RoR frameworks
  • Mixed experience in at least 2 complimentary languages, such as Javascript or Python
  • Familiarity with common devOps practices needed for deploying and maintaining cloud based deployments, preferably AWS
  • Experience working with common finance and accounting system integrations such as Xero, Quickbooks, NetSuite, etc. Familiarity with developing invoicing systems is a major plus.
  • Working knowledge of standard CS fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, complexity analysis)
  • Strong communication skills and a process driven approach
  • Thorough understanding of standard Git workflows
  • Ability to work in an agile and fast-paced work environment

Benefits

  • Health and Wellness benefits including competitive medical, dental, and vision plans
  • Performance-based bonuses and stock options
  • Generous vacation and time off benefits including paid holidays
  • Generally flexible working hours
  • Working in the WeWork in Paddington, London
  • A collaborative culture where unconventional thinkers come together to solve interesting problems and having fun while doing it
  • Mission-driven company that is making the world a better place

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.description:
We’re looking for humble, but ambitious, razor-sharp Software Engineer significant depth in Ruby. Like us, you take SDLC, CI/CD, API, Analytics and integrations seriously; you’re passionate about technology and, even more so, about product development. We embrace those who see things differently, aren’t afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints. That’s where you come in. We are currently seeking a senior software engineer to help us realize our technical vision in an innovative and fast paced environment. Our selection process will emphasize technical and architectural skills as well as engineering fundamentals equally. The ideal candidate must be a master of their domain. Furthermore, the ideal candidate must be able to inspire and champion through influence when the need arises. We are looking for a rare mix of intelligence, integrity, domain knowledge, verbal agility, and diplomacy which allows you to rapidly earn the trust of technically astute engineers and product astute product management leaders.


Why We Need This Role

We are looking for a senior software engineer to help us realize our Builder Product and Enterprise Management systems visions and enable us to continue turning client’s ideas into a fully functioning software at massive scale.

Why You Should Join

This is a challenging and diverse role that requires you to constantly operate near bleeding edges of technology. You’ll be surrounded by teammates who never say “I do not know how” or “I have never done that before,” and constantly opt for “how about we try this!” Only join this role if you are craving rapid growth, able to create a path in uncharted territory, and comfortable with trying, failing and course-correcting fast.


First Six Month Deliverables
* Collaborate with designers, product managers, and other software developers to deliver compelling user-facing products or enterprise wide integrations
* As a part of the engineering scrum team, contribute to the architecture of efficient and reusable components that drive complex applications across the stack
* Create integration and unit testing tools and hooks that enable availability and scalability
* Identify and resolve functional, performance and scalability issues

Requirements

* Strong drive and sense of ownership of the challenges we take on, coupled with a team-oriented, can-do attitude
* 5 plus years of relevant experience managing fast-paced and dynamic software engineering teams
* Working knowledge of standard CS fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, complexity analysis)
* A systematic debugging and problem solving methodology
* Experience in globally geo distributed environments is a strong plus

* Devops experience are strong plus
* Have built your own Gem.
* Integration of third party API’s, scraping, heavy data processing.

* CS degree required or equivalent work experience
* Capable of technical deep-dives, yet verbally and cognitively agile enough to hold their own in a product dialog
* Experienced with Agile / Scrum methodologies
* Expert understanding of object oriented and procedural Software Engineering, Data Engineering and cloud computing fundamentals
* Expert understanding of Ruby
* Expert understanding of SQL and NoSQL database architecture, strong understanding of RDS and data streaming services
* Strong understanding of and experience with testing practices including unit testing, integration testing, acceptance, and load testing
* Strong automation and CI / CD experience
* Strong software and data security expertise
* Pivotal Tracker or Jira, GitHub, CD/CI tools experience, some would say you are a master.
* If I asked your previous team members about you, they would say you were a great teammate and they would very much welcome an opportunity to work with you once again

Benefits

* Health and Wellness benefits including competitive medical, dental, and vision plans
* Performance-based bonuses and stock options
* Generous vacation and time off benefits including paid holidays
* Generally flexible working hours
* Working in a beautiful office space the heart of Silicon Beach in Playa Vista
* A collaborative culture where unconventional thinkers come together to solve interesting problems and having fun while doing it
* Mission-driven company that is making the world a better place

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Ruby on Rails
jobs.description:
We are looking for a Ruby on Rails developer that brings their own ideas to the table. This person must have significant expertise in ROR, as well as be highly detail oriented and self-driven. Furthermore, they must be able to inspire and mentor others when the need arises. We are looking for someone never says “I do not know how”, or “I have never done that before” - rather a person that says how about we try this


* Architecting and designing scalable backend systems
* Integration and development of various microservices
* Creating unit tests using RSpec
* Reviewing other developers code as well as suggesting improvements
* Algorithm development and general optimization
* Setting up CI/CD pipelines
* Collaborating with various stakeholders including QA, DevOps, PMs and other developers
* At Least 2 years solid experience on Ruby on Rails, including at least one start to finish project where you were the lead developer or a primary contributor.
* Solid understanding of deploying and maintaining Rails apps within the AWS environment.
* Ability to set up workers and deploy across multiple instances.
* Git experience, some would say you are a git master.
* If I asked your previous co-workers about you, they would say you were a good team player


6 Months Deliverable:

* Collaborate with designers, product managers, and other software developers to deliver compelling user-facing products
* Lead teams of developers in architecting efficient and reusable systems that drive complex applications across the stack
* Create instrumentation, monitoring, and alerting tools to ensure availability/scalability during peak traffic times and implement solutions to maximize uptime
* Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues


Requirements

* A strong drive and sense of ownership of the challenges we take on, coupled with a team-oriented, can-do attitude
* Working knowledge of standard CS fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, complexity analysis)
* A professional proficiency in English
* A systematic debugging and problem solving methodology
* Minimum of four years of experience with Rails 4/5


Bonus Skills:

* Devops experience (chef/jenkins etc.)
* Understanding of the mobile landscape and how they interact with Restful API’s.
* Have built your own Gem.
* Python
* Integration of third party API’s, scraping, heavy data processing.

Benefits

Engineer.ai is an online platform for building software using AI & a marketplace of teams. Builder takes care of everything from idea to app and CloudOps ensures that your idea stays healthy and operates efficiently in the Cloud.

Engineer.ai’s vision is to be the #1 way to Build Software and ultimately to be the connect between every idea and product; helping everyone who wants to engage in technology without needing to know how to build it.

jobs.title: Solutions Architect - Software Engineer (CTE)
jobs.description:
We are looking for a versatile & out of box innovator who will be at the forefront of cutting edge AI technology that is disrupting a combined $800 billion (and growing) industry for software build and operate services, selling into both the B2C and B2B markets. The Solutions Architect (Or what we call in house or Customer Technical Expert (CTE)) will champion all technical aspects of client’s projects from Ideation and Technical Architecture to Execution and Delivery. Our selection process will emphasize hands-on software engineering and architecture skills as well as execution and organizational skills equally. The ideal candidate must be a master of the engineering domain, be senior level hands-on expert in at least one of the following technologies (Ruby, Angular, iOS Swift or Android Java) and be able to contribute as an individual contributor (software engineer and architect) at least a third of the time. These experts play the role of the lead product technologist to the customer.



Why We Need This Role

Customer Technical Expert (CTE) will help us implement customer projects that are robust in development and technically sound. CTE will partner with Customer Product Expert (CPE) to work with the creators from the supply network to ensure that the code development and architecture is robust - that will allow CPE to deliver customer projects with minimised bugs and architecture that allows easy scalability.



Why You Should Join

This role will give you an experience of working on a plethora of bespoke software development projects delivered from an aggregated creator network. This role will give you an experience of delivering technical expertise at scale while maintaining a high level of hands-on software development craft as well as an opportunity to help build a programmatic model of working with a large aggregated network. Combination of both will be a unique experience and a specialized skill set in the new world of business and technical models.



First Six Month Deliverables

* On time delivery of the project (as per build card)
* Code reusability
* Code quality - number of bugs in 90 days post shipment
* Customer tech team satisfaction feedback (where applicable)
* CP Network Rating

Requirements

* Passionate about loosely held values and ideas. We want someone who has experience but is not blinded by the path already taken.
* 4 plus years solid experience as a technical lead
* 5 plus years solid experience with wide range of web and mobile technologies.
* Mastery of at least one of the following languages in a cloud based ecosystem:
** Ruby
** Angular
** iOS Swift
** Android Java

* A proven track record of senior level software engineering and architecture accomplishments in a high-capacity, large-scale, internet-based product platform
* Comfortable leading a team of capacity partner network based (i.e. outsourced and offshored) engineers capable of working on projects and at scale unlike any other they've encountered
* Solid procedural and object oriented Software Engineering fundamentals. Strong understanding of and experience with code review tools and practices
* Strong understanding of and experience with testing practices
* Strong automation and CI / CD experience. Pivotal Tracker or Jira, Docker, CI/CD, GitHub tools experience, some would say you are a master.

Benefits

* Health and Wellness benefits including competitive medical, dental, and vision plans
* Performance-based bonuses and stock options
* Generous vacation and time off benefits including paid holidays
* Generally flexible working hours
* Working in a beautiful office space the heart of Silicon Beach in Playa Vista
* A collaborative culture where unconventional thinkers come together to solve interesting problems and having fun while doing it
* Mission-driven company that is making the world a better place

jobs.title: Staff Product Manager - Tech (Platform)
jobs.description:
We are looking for an out of box innovator who will be interested in developing technologies that is disrupting a combined $800 billion (and growing) industry for software build and operate services, selling into both the B2C and B2B markets. The Product Manager will take an initiative from Design to Delivery and will be responsible for its results. These experts play the role of the product to the customer.

Why We Need This Role

As a Staff Product Manager you will be challenged to revolutionize product solutions in omni-channel inventory management, specifically influencing our customer promise in the areas of: Assembly and Frameworking - these are rapidly expanding technology areas and we’re at the forefront of the industry. The explosive growth and disruption requires a visionary, and a dynamic product leader who is able to handle uncertainties, has a wider perspective, and is good at connecting the dots. You will partner with key stakeholders across the entire organization, and lead the vision for how we will enable demand capcity partners to automate development cycle


Requirements

* Lead product strategy, vision, roadmap, and requirement specifications
* Drive product discovery, research process for large, complex projects
* Work with executives and stakeholders, and partner closely with cross-functional teams to take supply chain products to the next level
* Define requirements, drive adoption, lead user acceptance testing, and address business and system issues
* Partner very closely with engineering teams on product design, development, and deployment in a fast paced, agile environment
* Ensure we are building globally usable, scalable software
* Focus on KPIs and data based decision making
* Communicate the benefits and champion the product throughout the organization
* Serve as a thought leader within the team and the broader enterprise
* Promotes and supports mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity

Benefits

* Health and Wellness benefits including competitive medical, dental, and vision plans
* Performance-based bonuses and stock options
* Generous vacation and time off benefits including paid holidays
* Generally flexible working hours
* Working in a beautiful office space the heart of Silicon Beach in Playa Vista
* A collaborative culture where unconventional thinkers come together to solve interesting problems and having fun while doing it
* Mission-driven company that is making the world a better place

Comfortable of leading a team of capacity partner network based (i.e. outsourced and offshored) engineers capable of working on projects and at scale unlike any other they've encountered

This role will give you an experience of working on a plethora of bespoke software development projects delivered from an aggregated creator network. This role will give you an experience of delivering technical expertise at scale while maintaining a high level of hands-on software development craft as well as an opportunity to help build a programmatic model of working with a large aggregated network. Combination of both will be a unique experience and a specialised skill set in the new world of business and technical models.


First Six Month Deliverables

* On time delivery of the project (as per build card)
* Code reusability
* Code quality - number of bugs in 90 days post shipment
* Customer tech team satisfaction feedback (where applicable)
* CP Network Rating

Requirements

* Passionate about loosely held values and ideas. We want someone who has experience but is not blinded by the path already taken.
* 8 plus years solid experience with wide range of web and mobile technologies.
* Mastery of at least one of the following languages in a cloud based ecosystem:
** Ruby
** Angular
** iOS (Swift)
** Android (Java)

* 4 plus years solid experience as a technical lead, including at least 2 years in large scale product environment
* A proven track record of senior level software engineering and architecture accomplishments in a high-capacity, large-scale, internet-based product platform
* Comfortable leading a team of capacity partner network based (i.e. outsourced and offshored) engineers capable of working on projects and at scale unlike any other they've encountered
* Solid procedural and object oriented Software Engineering fundamentals. Strong understanding of and experience with code review tools and practices
* Strong understanding of and experience with testing practices
* Strong automation and CI / CD experience. Pivotal Tracker or Jira, Docker, CI/CD, GitHub tools experience, some would say you are a master.

Benefits

* Health and Wellness benefits
* Performance-based bonuses and stock options
* Generous vacation and time off benefits including paid holidays (24 holidays + 8 bank holidays)
* Generally flexible working hours
* Working in the WeWork office in Paddington
* A collaborative culture where unconventional thinkers come together to solve interesting problems and having fun while doing it
* Mission-driven company that is making the world a better place

jobs.title: Technical Lead
jobs.description:
We’re looking for humble, but ambitious, razor-sharp technical lead who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. Like us, you take product development, API, Analytics and ML or AI platform engineering seriously; you’re passionate about technology and, even more so, about leadership. We embrace those who see things differently, aren’t afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints. That’s where you come in. We are currently seeking an engineering Technical Lead to drive technical vision and execution as well as provide architectural and functional leadership to a team of engineers in an innovative and fast paced environment. Our selection process will emphasize software engineering and architecture skills as well as SDLC or scrum process organizational skills equally. The ideal candidate must be a master of the engineering domain and be able to contribute as an individual contributor (software engineer and architect) at least half of the time. We are looking for someone who is equally comfortable leading by influence or authority. Last, we are looking for a rare mix of intelligence, integrity, domain knowledge, verbal agility, and diplomacy which allows you to rapidly earn the trust of technically astute engineers and product astute product managers.


Why We Need This Role

We are looking for a leader to help us build out a set of AI powered tools and services which will allow us to pro-grammatically assemble licensed client applications from the building blocks of code. This includes, but not limited to, developing ESB technology that will serve as assembly foundation for said assemblies to programmatic orchestration of underpinning infrastructure. We want to do this to disrupt and automate software development in a similar fashion Henry Ford’s assembly lines disrupted and automated car manufacturing.

Why You Should Join

This is a challenging and diverse role that requires you to build both, an organization and new generation of Builder Assembly product, nearly from the ground up. Only join this role if you are craving rapid growth, able to create a path in uncharted territory, and comfortable with trying, failing and course-correcting fast.


First Six Month Deliverables
* Grow Builder ESB team
* Grow Builder ESB team to be capable of parallelized and autonomous license activation and building block bus development efforts
* Develop ESB technology that will serve as a foundation for each client project assembly as well as a programmatic means for building blocks assembly into apps or underpinning infrastructure creation.

Requirements

* 10 plus years solid experience in back end open source based technologies, including at least 2 years in Ruby or RoR cloud based ecosystems
* A minimum of 4 plus years solid experience as a technical lead, including at least 2 years in large scale platform environment
* CS degree required or equivalent work experience
* Solid procedural and object oriented Software Engineering fundamentals
* 3 plus years of relevant experience managing fast-paced and dynamic Scrum team
* A proven track record of senior level software engineering and architecture accomplishments in a high-capacity, large-scale, internet-based product platform
* Capable of technical deep-dives, yet verbally and cognitively agile enough to hold their own in a strategy discussion with senior technical or product leadership
* Comfortable recruiting a team of very bright, experienced engineers capable of working on projects and at scale unlike any other they've encountered
* Very experienced with Agile / Scrum methodologies
* Outstanding communication skills, both written and oral
* Expert understanding of RoR framework

* Solid understanding of AWS services
* Solid experience with containerized applications and serverless functions

* Strong understanding of and experience with testing practices
* Strong automation and CI / CD experience
* Pivotal Tracker or Jira, Docker, CI/CD, GitHub tools experience, some would say you are a master
* If I asked your previous team members about you, they would say you were a great leader and even better contributor. They would also very much welcome an opportunity to work for you once again

* Some experience collaborating with ML/AI teams is a plus
* Experience in data-driven environments

Benefits

* Health and Wellness benefits including competitive medical, dental, and vision plans
* Performance-based bonuses and stock options
* Generous vacation and time off benefits including paid holidays
* Generally flexible working hours
* Working in a beautiful office space the heart of Silicon Beach in Playa Vista
* A collaborative culture where unconventional thinkers come together to solve interesting problems and having fun while doing it
* Mission-driven company that is making the world a better place

jobs.title: Technical Lead
jobs.description:
In Engineer.ai we believe that anyone, irrespective of technical knowledge, should be able to build and operate technology. We make software accessible to everyone.

How?

We are an AI-assisted platform building bespoke software for our customers, making it faster, more accessible and less expensive for everyone.

We launched in 2012, and last year we secured $29.5m of funding to scale our growth in Europe. We have already two big offices in L.A and in Delhi and we are working hard to keep growing there. However our focus for this year is to build up the one we have in London.

Why We Need This Role

We are building out a set of AI/ML-powered tools and services which will allow us to automatically optimize client cloud infrastructure by detecting underutilized/unutilized resources, retrovision on the fly, and better predict spending patterns. Which means you will be creating a modular and robust platform that can integrate with multiple cloud providers such as AWS, Digital Ocean, Azure, etc.

Why You Should join

This is an amazing opportunity for someone passionate about technology and, even more so, about leadership. Someone who wants rapid growth, is able to create a path in uncharted territory, and is comfortable with trying, failing and course-correcting fast.


First Six Month Deliverables

* Driving technical vision and execution as well as provide architectural and functional leadership to a team of engineers in an innovative and fast-paced environment.
* Creating an autonomous team that can coordinate with DevOps and data science teams and work in a service oriented architecture
* Develop the first version of the intelligent usage statement that can detect and action underutilized/unutilized infrastructure, identify overutilized infrastructure and recommend RI commitments

Requirements

* You love working with Ruby and Rails but are also open minded to other technologies
* You have been leading teams, even if there were small ones.
* You are familiar with AWS services. Experience with containerized applications and serverless functions would be amazing.
* You have been working in fast-paced and dynamic Scrum teams.
* You have experience in automation and CI/CD.
* You want to work with tools such as Pivotal Tracker or Jira, Docker, GitHub.
* Passionate about loosely held values and ideas. We want someone who has experience but is not blinded by the path already taken.

Benefits

* Health and Wellness benefits
* Performance-based bonuses and stock options
* Vacation and time off benefits including paid holidays (24 holidays + 8 bank holidays)
* Generally flexible working hours
* Working in a WeWork office space in the heart of Paddington
* A collaborative culture where unconventional thinkers come together to solve interesting problems and having fun while doing it

jobs.title: Technical Lead - Backend Engineering
jobs.description:
We’re looking for humble, but ambitious, razor-sharp Back-End Engineering technical leader who can teach us a thing or two. We promise to return the favor. Like us, you take product development, cloud services
research and platform engineering seriously; you’re passionate about technology and, even more so, about leadership. We embrace those who see things differently, aren’t afraid to experiment, and who have a healthy disregard for constraints. That’s where you come in. 
We are currently seeking a Technical Lead of Back-End Engineering to help senior management drive technical vision, architectural guidance and provide leadership for a team of BE engineers in an innovative and fast paced environment. Our selection process will emphasize hands on engineering and other technical or architectural skills as well as leadership/management/SDLC process/organizational skills equally. The ideal candidate must be a master
of their domain and be able to contribute as an individual contributor (software engineer and architect) half of the time. Furthermore, the ideal candidate must be able to improve SDLC and Scrum processes or inspire, champion and teach his / her team when the need arises. We are looking for a rare mix of
intelligence, integrity, domain knowledge, verbal and written agility, and diplomacy which allows you to rapidly earn the trust of technically astute engineers and product astute product managers.

Responsible:
● Responsible for championing persistence, business logic and other back-end layers architectural and SDLC process strategy as well as the planning and successful execution of said strategy
● Effectively balance technical leadership and software engineering individual contributor responsibilities
● Directly or indirectly drive BE projects and provide architectural and technical leadership in an innovative and fast-paced environment
● Continually retrospect and drive innovation within the back-end development process to ensure our software engineers execute at the highest possible level
● Hire, onboard, develop and manage Back-End (BE) engineers
● Manage Tech Debt management
● Responsible for execution of SDLC processes to include sprint pre-planning/planning, retros, demos, architecture and code reviews
● Work closely with the rest of the tech leads, data scientists, senior engineering leadership and product managers to ensure we're building awesome, feature-rich, scalable and secure product lines, products and features
● Work closely with the rest of the tech leads and senior engineering leadership team to ensure we're building highly reusable codebase
● Provide the mentoring and guidance to BE engineers. Create an environment for BE engineers to continually reach new heights within their career
